com.dhemery.expressions

Interface PolledExpressions

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Eventually, Poller

    public interface PolledExpressions
extends Poller, Eventually
    Methods to compose conditions, evaluate them by polling, and act on the results.
    See Also:
    Eventually, Expressions, Poller

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default void assertThat(PollingSchedule schedule, SelfDescribingBooleanSupplier supplier)
      Asserts that the supplier returns true within the schedule's duration.
      default <T,V> void assertThat(PollingSchedule schedule, T subject, SelfDescribingFunction<? super T,V> function, Matcher<? super V> matcher)

    • Method Detail

      • assertThat

        default void assertThat(PollingSchedule schedule,
                        SelfDescribingBooleanSupplier supplier)
        Asserts that the supplier returns true within the schedule's duration.
        Parameters:
        schedule - the polling interval and duration
        supplier - the supplier to evaluate
        Throws:
        AssertionError - if the schedule duration expires before the supplier returns true

      • assertThat

        default <T> void assertThat(PollingSchedule schedule,
                            T subject,
                            SelfDescribingPredicate<? super T> predicate)
        Asserts that the predicate accepts the subject within the schedule's duration.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the subject
        Parameters:
        subject - the subject to evaluate
        predicate - evaluates the subject
        schedule - the polling interval and duration
        Throws:
        AssertionError - if the schedule duration expires before the predicate accepts the subject

      • assertThat

        default <T,V> void assertThat(PollingSchedule schedule,
                              T subject,
                              SelfDescribingFunction<? super T,V> function,
                              SelfDescribingPredicate<? super V> predicate)
        Asserts that the predicate accepts the value that the function derives from the subject within the schedule's duration.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the subject
        V - the type of the derived value
        Parameters:
        subject - the subject to evaluate
        function - derives the value of interest from the subject
        predicate - evaluates the derived value
        schedule - the polling interval and duration
        Throws:
        AssertionError - if the schedule duration expires before the predicate accepts the value that the function derives from the subject

      • satisfiedThat

        default boolean satisfiedThat(PollingSchedule schedule,
                              SelfDescribingBooleanSupplier supplier)
        Evaluates whether the supplier returns true within the schedule's duration.
        Parameters:
        schedule - the polling interval and duration
        supplier - the supplier to evaluate
        Returns:
        true if the supplier returns true within the schedule's duration, and false otherwise.

      • satisfiedThat

        default <T> boolean satisfiedThat(PollingSchedule schedule,
                                  T subject,
                                  SelfDescribingPredicate<? super T> predicate)

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the subject
        Parameters:
        subject - the subject to evaluate
        predicate - evaluates the subject
        schedule - the polling interval and duration
        Returns:

      • satisfiedThat

        default <T,V> boolean satisfiedThat(PollingSchedule schedule,
                                    T subject,
                                    SelfDescribingFunction<? super T,V> function,
                                    SelfDescribingPredicate<? super V> predicate)
        Evaluates whether the predicate accepts the value that the function derives from the subject within the schedule's duration.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the subject
        V - the type of the derived value
        Parameters:
        schedule - the polling interval and duration
        subject - the subject to evaluate
        function - derives the value of interest from the subject
        predicate - evaluates the derived value
        Returns:
        true if the supplier returns true within the schedule's duration, and false otherwise.

                                    T subject,

                                    Matcher<? super V> matcher)

      • waitUntil

        default void waitUntil(SelfDescribingBooleanSupplier supplier)
        Waits until the supplier returns true.
        Parameters:
        supplier - the supplier to evaluate
        Throws:
        PollTimeoutException - if the default polling schedule's duration expires before the supplier returns true
